author: BBC News
title: What's behind Japan's culture of overworking? #Japan #BBCNews

author: BBC News
description:
"It's really difficult to grasp the extent of this melt."
 
That's according to Dr Matthias Huss who first visited Rhône Glacier in Switzerland 35 years ago.
 
Now, images show how the glaciers of Switzerland have disappeared over the last three decades, from the ground and space.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 
#switzerland  #Glaciers #BBCNews
title: How Switzerland's glaciers have rapidly declined | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
They look and taste like any other tomato, but these tomatoes in Norfolk have been genetically altered to contain more vitamin D.
 
Tomatoes traditionally lack being a good source for vitamin D, but these gene-edited contain an adult's daily allowance in just four.
 
But why is this being done? Well, Professor Martin Warren from the Quadram Institute says during the summer, humans have enough sun to create their own vitamin D, but in the winter months, food sources for the vitamin are vital.

Picture credit: Getty

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#Tomatoes #Food #BBCNews
title: Why are tomatoes being genetically altered for vitamin D? | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
US President Donald Trump has said Israel has agreed to a withdrawal line in Gaza and that an immediate ceasefire will take place as soon as Hamas agrees to his 20-point plan.
 
Israeli strikes on Gaza continued overnight ahead of indirect talks between Israel and Hamas negotiators in Egypt on Monday, with hopes the plan could put an end to almost two years of war.
 
Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Saturday he hopes to announce news of the remaining hostages being released in the coming days.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#Israel #Gaza #BBCNews
title: 'Israel agrees Gaza withdrawal line', says US President Donald Trump | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
After being deployed to Portland, Oregon and Washington DC in recent weeks and months, US President Donald Trump has said Chicago is next to have the National Guard sent to its streets.
 
Illinois Governor JB Pritzker said the president was abusing his power and that Trump was "attempting to manufacture a crisis".
 
White House spokeswoman Abigail Jackson said: "Amidst ongoing violent riots and lawlessness, that local leaders like [Gov] Pritzker have refused to step in to quell, President Trump has authorized 300 national guardsmen to protect federal officers and assets".

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news
 
#US #Chicago #NationalGuard #BBCNews
title: Donald Trump authorises deployment of 300 National Guard troops in Chicago | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Today, Laura has visited the scene of the Manchester synagogue attack and spoken to members of the local community. 

Paddy and Laura discuss the political reaction to Thursday’s attack on the Heaton Park Hebrew Congregation Synagogue. 

Plus, Kemi Badenoch has arrived in Manchester for her first Conservative party conference as leader. What’s at stake for her? And are we about to see her vision of Badenochism?

You can now listen to Newscast on a smart speaker. If you want to listen, just say "Ask BBC Sounds to play Newscast”. It works on most smart speakers.
title: 'UK will leave ECHR if I'm Prime Minister', says Kemi Badenoch| BBC Newscast
